thoughts.text: I will use the execute_shell command with the "curl" command to make a GET request to the website of the hiking trail, and then use the execute_python_file command to run the Python file that uses the Google Maps API to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail.
thoughts.reasoning: The execute_shell command with the "curl" command can be used to make a GET request to the website of the hiking trail, which will allow me to obtain the necessary information about the trail. The execute_python_file command can then be used to run the Python file that uses the Google Maps API to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail.
thoughts.plan:
- Use the execute_shell command with the "curl" command to make a GET request to the website of the hiking trail
- Use the execute_python_file command to run the Python file that uses the Google Maps API to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail
- Plan my adventure accordingly, including what time to leave and how long to spend on the trail
thoughts.criticism: I need to make sure that I am accounting for traffic and other potential delays when calculating the travel time to the hiking trail.
thoughts.speak: I will use the execute_shell command with the "curl" command to make a GET request to the website of the hiking trail, and then use the execute_python_file command to run the Python file that uses the Google Maps API to calculate the distance and travel time to the hiking trail.

args.command_line: curl https://www.nps.gov/yell/planyourvisit/hiking.htm | grep "Mount Washburn" | awk '{print $2}' | tr -d '"' | xargs python3 calculate_distance.py
